TopicTitle: Very happy about the new leg physics

Articles.Content:
Recently i wanted to land on minmus, but i didnt have the patience to adjust my trajectory so i would land on one of minmus's icelakes.

Eventually when i was touching down i was landing on a slope with a gradient of about 30 to 40 degrees with quite a long rocket.

Though once the RCS thrusters got rid of the rotational speed from the rocket tipping over to the side it managed to keep upright and not tip over.

in 0.15 i remember rockets just sliding away with anything that wasnt completely flat.

Well done, it's awesome!

Edited August 4, 2012 by MissStabby

They seem a lot sturdier, too, and I love the telescoping animation.

I like the "Leaning tower of Rocket Fuel" look you have going on there.

By the way... you might mean 0.15?
As kurtjmac would say: The legs are far less explody.
i still remember those other legs, touching down with anything above 2m/s turning into a springboard launching my craft into a backflip or even into orbit...
I survived one of those backflip-landings once. Jeb never stopped smiling; I think Bob might have puked though.
I rather enjoyed but was frustrated with the explosive legs. I still love how everything explodes though. Land a spaceplane on the airstrip perfectly then boom a parachute explodes. Is so great!
I like the fact that I can actually use these legs, the last stock ones frustrated me so much i resorted to the static mod legs.
I have never used the old ones since 0.16 was released, they are just 100x better.
